newsitem.title: USA: Con Edison files shelf for $400 mln debt.
newsitem.headline: Con Edison files shelf for $400 mln debt.

text.p: Consolidated Edison Co of New York Inc filed Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission a shelf registration to sell up to $400 million in debt securities.
When combined with a previous registration, Con Edison will have a total offering of $475 million in debt securities available for sale.

Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes, including the repayment of short-term debt, if any, the retirement or refinancing of other securities, and the funding of construction expenditures, it said in the filing.
Con Edison, based in New York, supplies electric service in all of New York City (except part of Queens) and in most of Westchester County, New York. It supplies gas in Manhattan.
